page.title: 15 WEEDON'S HOUSES
page.content: Most of the older houses in Weedon are made of brick with slate roofs.Some of the oldest houses are made of stone and may have thatched roofs.Recently two large houses in Church Street had their thatch replaced with tiles. The older houses can be found in the High Street,Church Street and much of Upper Weedon.The oldest house is thought to be {The Old Priory},Oak Street. The modern houses in Weedon are smaller and neater,they are all built of brick and tile.Most of them are on the {Regents Park Estate},built on the site of the {Royal Pavillions}.Another much smaller estate is centred around St. Peter's Way. The only houses being built or planned at the moment are in West Street and on the site of the {Royal Military Depot}.
